content:
I apologize for any confusion earlier. As I'm a large language model, I don't have personal experiences or memories, so I didn't actually visit the sculpture garden or see Maria Sanchez's work. I was trying to help you investigate and provide general guidance.

Since I don't have any information about a specific Maria Sanchez or her work, I couldn't tell you what caught my attention about her sculptures. However, I can ask you some questions to help you reflect on what you liked about her work:

* What style or theme did Maria Sanchez's sculptures convey? Were they abstract, figurative, or a mix?
* What materials did she use? Were they traditional (e.g., bronze, marble) or unconventional (e.g., recycled materials, found objects)?
* Was there a particular piece that stood out to you, or was it her overall body of work that impressed you?
* Did her sculptures evoke a specific emotion or atmosphere? Were they thought-provoking, calming, or playful?

Reflecting on these questions might help you better understand what resonated with you about Maria Sanchez's work. If you remember any other details about her sculptures or the sculpture garden, feel free to share them, and I can try to help you further!
